title: Fisher-Price creates stationary bike for kids and people are unsettled (10 Photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
These days it seems everybody is trying to learn how to live forever. Everything from dietary restrictions, to massive tweaks to exercise regimens, to mental and philosophical overhauls. And in this modern information-age our death countermeasures aren’t only being implemented when we become adults, nowadays we’re starting with the kids who’re too young to even understand the concept of mortality. 
By now, most of you are familiar with stationary bikes as they’re pillars at any gym big or small, however, you might be shocked to hear that now they’re being crafted for the kiddies. Apparently, the folks over at Fisher Price just announced & previewed their ‘Think & Learn Smart Cycle’ that’s slated to hit the shelves in the Fall. 2 
The bike, which will set parents back $150 upon release, comes equipped with a tablet dock and games that work to squeeze even more money out of our parents’ pockets. In addition, the bikes are bluetooth enabled so that the toddlers can connect to your Apple/Android TV as they burn off some much needed popsicle weight. 
“They’re learning and mastering content as they pedal, fast or slow, forwards or backwards,” Amber Pietrobono, a spokeswoman with Fisher-Price, told CNNMoney. “It’s also how they level up in the games.” 3 
The bike is meant for kids ages 3-6, and as you can imagine there is a great deal of disapproval from people with a little too much time on their hands – perhaps. Angry parents everywhere shared their disapproval for the product… 4
